rule.name: Declare required attributes in SiteDefinition
rule.description:
Required attributes Title and ListDir must be declared in SiteDefinition.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not implement SiteDefinition
rule.description:
Depending on the customization policy do not implement a SiteDefinition.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Reference 15 hive within all Scripts (.js)
rule.description:
Paths in Scripts to '/_controltemplates/', '/_layouts/' and '/_layouts/images/' should point to 15 hive.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: No assignment in conditional statement
rule.description:
In most cases this is an error in the code, and unintended

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Consider to not use, or shim the console object
rule.description:
The console object is only available in IE, after the developer console has been opened once, therefore throwing an error

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Consider to disallow Controls Characters in Regular Expressions
rule.description:
Control characters are special, invisible characters in the ASCII range 0-31. These characters are rarely used in JavaScript strings so a regular expression containing these characters is most likely a mistake.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Consider to disallow extra boolean casts
rule.description:
In contexts such as an if statement's test where the result of the expression will already be coerced to a Boolean, casting to a Boolean via double negation (!!) is unnecessary.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Disallow negated left operand of 'in' operator
rule.description:
This is an error, if one intended this usage it should be explicitly coerced

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Disallow Global Object Function Calls
rule.description:
Quote from ESLint 'ECMAScript provides several global objects that are intended to be used as-is. Some of these objects look as if they could be constructors due their capitalization (such as Math and JSON) but will throw an error if you try to execute them as functions.'

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Disallow usage of NaN directly
rule.description:
Quote from ESLint 'In JavaScript, NaN is a special value of the Number type. It's used to represent any of the "not-a-number" values represented by the double-precision 64-bit format as specified by the IEEE Standard for Binary Floating-Point Arithmetic. NaN has the unique property of not being equal to anything, including itself. That is to say, that the condition NaN !== NaN evaluates to true.'

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Ensure type checks are against valid types
rule.description:
This rule prevents spelling mistakes in 'typeof' unary operator checks. Valid types are symbol, undefined, object, boolean, number, string and function.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Assignment to function name not allowed
rule.description:
This is strictly not allowed in ECMAScript, however some browsers allow it by accident

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not do toString directly on method objects
rule.description:
Do not do function.ToString() comparisons directly as they are handled differently in each browser, always assign to a variable first

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Disallow use of delete on variables
rule.description:
'delete' is exclusively for use with object properties

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Catch identifiers should be unique
rule.description:
Catch identifiers should be unique

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Ambiguous named function expression
rule.description:
Ambiguous named function expression

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Export not at module level
rule.description:
Export not at module level

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Numeric literal causes overflow or underflow exception
rule.description:
Numeric literal causes overflow or underflow exception

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Strict operator always evaluates to true or false
rule.description:
Strict operator always evaluates to true or false

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Array literal trailing commas has cross-browser difference
rule.description:
Array literal trailing commas has cross-browser difference

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Variable or function declaration redefines the catch error name
rule.description:
Variable or function declaration redefines the catch error name

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Constant declaration already declared
rule.description:
Constant declaration already declared

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Duplicate lexical declaration; cannot redefine let or const variables
rule.description:

See SPCAF documentation

rule.description:

rule.description:

rule.name: Low-surrogate pair value not preceeded by high-surrogate value
rule.description:

rule.name: Function declaration should not be inside a statement. Cross-browser behavior difference
rule.description:

rule.name: Reserved word used as object literal property name; cross-browser issue
rule.description:

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Identifier already in use
rule.description:

rule.name: Octal literals are deprecated. Possible cross-browser behavior difference
rule.description:

rule.name: New line not allowed
rule.description:

rule.name: Suspect assigment

rule.description:

rule.name: Too many tokens have been skipped in the process of recovering from errors. The file may not be a JScript.NET file
rule.description:
Too many tokens have been skipped in the process of recovering from errors. The file may not be a JScript.NET file

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Did you intend to have an empty statement for this branch of the if statement?
rule.description:
Did you intend to have an empty statement for this branch of the if statement?

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: A variable argument list must be the last argument
rule.description:
A variable argument list must be the last argument

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Function expression expected
rule.description:
Function expression expected

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: JSParser Exception
rule.description:
JSParser Exception

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Resource reference must be single constant value
rule.description:
Resource reference must be single constant value

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Conditiona compilation structure too complex
rule.description:
Conditiona compilation structure too complex

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Unterminated ASP.NET block
rule.description:
Unterminated ASP.NET block

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Strict-mode does not allow with-statements
rule.description:
Strict-mode does not allow with-statements

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Strict-mode does not allow duplicate argument names
rule.description:
Strict-mode does not allow duplicate argument names

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Use of eval can compromise site security
rule.description:
Use of eval, and eval type functions causes severe security cross site scripting attack loopholes, on the site

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Use of implied eval can compromise site security
rule.description:
Use of implied eval, and eval type functions causes severe security cross site scripting attack loopholes, on the site

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Disallow use of script URLs
rule.description:
This causes the browser to eval the code target, opening up a point for a cross site scripting attack

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Consider to disallow use of Comma Operator
rule.description:
The comma operator used in sequences can cause confusion what the code should actually return

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Consider the use of a Namespace registration method, instead of object chains
rule.description:
Warning, do not declare code in the global namespace directly. Instead consider using the $_global_ namespace pattern with a Namespace registration method, this will ensure correct execution with the MDS garbage collector

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Variable names considered reserved for SharePoint
rule.description:
Some variable names are considered reserved in SharePoint Context

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Consider to use built in helper method, instead of type checking null, and undefined
rule.description:
Consider to use built in helper method from SharePoint (SP.ScriptUtility isNullOrEmptyString, isNullorUndefined, isUndefined and truncateToInt), instead of type checking null, and undefined

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Consider to not use $
rule.description:
Consider to not use $ in your code in SharePoint 2010 directory. The $ variable is registered by SharePoint for the CMS Site Manager, and the Asset Portal Browser.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Warning, document.all only works in IE8
rule.description:
Warning, document.all only works in IE8, and is not supported in ECMAScript

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: JavaScript file uses SharePoint REST API
rule.description:
JavaScript file uses SharePoint REST API

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: JavaScript file uses SPServices
rule.description:
JavaScript file uses SPServices

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: JavaScript file uses SharePoint JavaScript Object Model
rule.description:
JavaScript file uses SharePoint JavaScript Object Model

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: JavaScript file uses Microsoft Graph REST API
rule.description:
JavaScript file uses Microsoft Graph REST API

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: JavaScript file uses Microsoft Graph beta REST API
rule.description:
JavaScript file uses Microsoft Graph beta REST API

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: JavaScript file uses Microsoft Graph v1.0 REST API
rule.description:
JavaScript file uses Microsoft Graph v1.0 REST API

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: JavaScript file uses Microsoft Graph SDK
rule.description:
JavaScript file uses Microsoft Graph SDK

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: JavaScript file uses PnP JavaScript Core Library
rule.description:
JavaScript file uses PnP JavaScript Core Library

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Consider using a "Value and Type" comparison in if statements
rule.description:
Consider using a "Value and Type" comparison in if statements, it is possible for values to be the same but types to be different. This helps to prevent cases such as "0 == false" from occuring. This isn't required were a type is asserted

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Consider not using 'arguments.callee' and arguments.caller'
rule.description:
Consider not using 'arguments.callee' and 'arguments.caller', these have been deprecated to allow for code optimisations in JavaScript. Consider replacing with a recursive callback were required

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Consider to not use empty labels
rule.description:
Consider to not use empty labels, goto is not supported in ECMAScript

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Missing break in switch statement
rule.description:
Missing break in switch statement, In most cases this is an error

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: __iterator__ is a reserved word
rule.description:
The __iterator__ property is not implemented in all browsers

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not reassign native objects
rule.description:
Native objects are protected from ECMA6 due to issues with reassigning

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not use new keyword without assignment
rule.description:
This creates an object without assignment to a variable

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Disallow use of the function constructor
rule.description:
This is implied code evaluation, the function contructor cause cross site scripting attack vulnerabilities in the code

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Consider to disallow primitive wrapper instances
rule.description:
Objects created from primitive wrappers, are not the same as the primitives themseleves, and used only internally

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: __proto__ is a reserved word
rule.description:
The __proto__ property is not implemented in all browsers

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: With statement is not recommended
rule.description:
With statement is not recommended

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Consider to not allow assignment in return statements
rule.description:
Assigning values inside a return statement, can cause confusion as to the codes intent

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Always supply a radix with parseInt
rule.description:
You must always supply a radix with parseInt, as some valid values will be shown as NaN (Not a Number)

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not declare code in the global namespace directly
rule.description:
Do not declare code in the global namespace directly. Instead consider using the $_global_ namespace pattern with Namespace registration, this will ensure correct execution with the MDS garbage collector

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Use the latest versions of JavaScript libraries
rule.description:
Use the latest versions of JavaScript libraries which contain the latest bug fixes and security patches

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Argument was defined but not referenced
rule.description:
Argument was defined but not referenced

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: A function was defined but not referenced
rule.description:
A function was defined but not referenced

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Function has not been declared
rule.description:
Function has not been declared

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: A variable was defined but not set or referenced
rule.description:
A variable was defined but not set or referenced

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Function name should be a simple identifier; possible browser-specific implementation
rule.description:
Function name should be a simple identifier; possible browser-specific implementation

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Object constructor takes no arguments
rule.description:
Object constructor takes no arguments

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Consider replacing maximum numeric literal with Number.MAX_VALUE
rule.description:
Consider replacing maximum numeric literal with Number.MAX_VALUE

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Consider replacing minimum numeric literal with Number.MIN_VALUE
rule.description:
Consider replacing minimum numeric literal with Number.MIN_VALUE

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Unused label
rule.description:
Unused label

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Consider to not use Alert, Confirm and Prompt messages boxes in production code
rule.description:
Consider to not use Alert, Confirm and Prompt messages boxes in production code, as these are considered bad usability

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Consider following curly brace conventions
rule.description:
Consider using curly brace convensions for all if, while, and for block

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Consider refactoring, too many parameters in function definition, maximum 3
rule.description:
Either use a monadic pattern to only ever use a single object, or refactor the method to reduce parameters, to a maximum of 3 in order to ease readability, and reduce code complexity.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Consider to not reference child methods, or values in a for loop sequence
rule.description:
This is a performance penalty, as this will generate a lookup during every loop

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Specify component type in the manifest
rule.description:
The manifest must specify the type of component

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Specify valid component type in the manifest
rule.description:
The manifest must specify a valid component type

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Specify the entry point for a bundle component
rule.description:
Bundle component must specify the entry point

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Component entry point in a bundle must point to a valid project file
rule.description:
Component entry point in a bundle must point to a valid project file

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Specify a valid bundle entry output path
rule.description:
Bundle entry must specify the bundle output path

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Bundle entry output path must be located under the dist folder
rule.description:
Bundle entry output path must be located under the dist folder

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Ensure that Web Part properties used in code are defined in the Web Part manifest
rule.description:
All Web Part properties used in code must be defined in the Web Part manifest

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Don't use HttpClient to connect to SharePoint
rule.description:
Don't use HttpClient to connect to SharePoint. Use the SPHttpClient instead

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Don't use PropertyPaneTextField with numeric properties
rule.description:
Don't use PropertyPaneTextField with numeric properties

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Don't load scripts from unapproved locations
rule.description:
Web Part loads script from a location that hasn't been approved

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Don't use web part properties without escaping
rule.description:
Web part properties values should be escaped before using them

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Don't reference scripts from unapproved locations
rule.description:
Web Part references script from a location that hasn't been approved

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Specify TypeScript linting rules
rule.description:
Specify TypeScript linting rules to use when verifying TypeScript code

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Project should list its dependencies in package.json or as external resources
rule.description:
Project should list the packages it depends on in the package.json file or as external resources

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Lock file missing
rule.description:
A lock file is used to lock down dependencies across projects, to ensure production uses the same dependency versions.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Validate web part properties' values
rule.description:
You should always validate web part properties' values

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Don't manipulate DOM elements outside the component
rule.description:
You should not manipulate DOM elements outside your component, as SharePoint DOM can change breaking your customization

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Script is served with support for CORS
rule.description:
Script is served with support for CORS

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Don't bundle external libraries in web part
rule.description:
Don't include external libraries in the web part bundle

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Don't include the same modules in multiple bundles
rule.description:
Don't include the same modules in multiple Client Side Web Part bundles

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Server hosting scripts has far future expiration header set
rule.description:
Server hosting scripts has far future expiration header set

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Script should be served GZipped
rule.description:
Script should be served GZipped

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Proxies should be able to cache the script
rule.description:
Proxies should be able to cache the script

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Script is served with an ETag
rule.description:
Script is served with an ETag

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Script should be served using HTTP/2
rule.description:
Script should be served using HTTP/2

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Always specify default route
rule.description:
Always specify default route to gracefully handle requests that don't match any route

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Don't inject invalid dependencies in module configs
rule.description:
When injecting dependencies in module configs ensure that they point to valid objects

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Number of injected dependencies matches the number of function parameters in module configs
rule.description:
When injecting dependencies in module configs ensure that they match the function parameters

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Use explicit dependency injection annotation in module configs with strict DI enabled
rule.description:
When bootstrapping application in strict DI mode, use explicit annotation to inject dependencies in module configs

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Don't manipulate DOM in controllers
rule.description:
Don't manipulate DOM in controllers as the HTML hasn't been fully rendered yet

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Don't inject invalid dependencies in controllers
rule.description:
When injecting dependencies in controllers ensure that they point to valid objects

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Number of injected dependencies matches the number of function parameters in controllers
rule.description:
When injecting dependencies in controllers ensure that they match the function parameters

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Use explicit dependency injection annotation in controllers with strict DI enabled
rule.description:
When bootstrapping application in strict DI mode, use explicit annotation to inject dependencies in controllers

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Don't inject invalid dependencies in directives
rule.description:
When injecting dependencies in directives ensure that they point to valid objects

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Number of injected dependencies matches the number of function parameters in directives
rule.description:
When injecting dependencies in directives ensure that they match the function parameters

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Use explicit dependency injection annotation in directives with strict DI enabled
rule.description:
When bootstrapping application in strict DI mode, use explicit annotation to inject dependencies in directives

rule.name: Route refers to a known controller
rule.description:
